name: Martha “Marty” Coen
description: Always remembers your order and never ages past forty-something.
hook: The clock above her counter resets to 6:23 every morning, no matter the repairs.

name: Sheriff Dale Rowland
description: By-the-book lawman who keeps a flask of holy water in his coat.
hook: Every arrest he makes vanishes from the records within a week.

name: Irene Maddox
description: Reads fortunes at the farmers’ market on weekends.
hook: Her teacups show images of missing people — who later return changed.

name: Caleb Muir
description: Rugged worker more comfortable with animals than people.
hook: Cattle found mutilated with surgical precision — no tracks in the mud.

name: Delia Harp
description: Runs the post office like a sacred trust.
hook: Keeps receiving mail from ‘The Future Route’ — dated next year.

name: Jonah Briggs
description: Pumps gas and tunes old radios on slow nights.
hook: Can only tune one station after dark — a voice reciting coordinates nearby.

name: Pastor Abigail Moore
description: Radiant smile, sermons heavy with warnings.
hook: Claims she hears confessions before people make them.

name: Ethan Cole
description: Can fix anything with an engine — except his own truck.
hook: Found oil leaking upward from the floor instead of down.

name: Penny Voss
description: Runs the single-room town library and whispers to the shelves.
hook: One shelf keeps rearranging itself into words — yesterday it said ‘RUN’.

name: Harold Gunn
description: Soft-spoken embalmer who hums gospel tunes at work.
hook: One body opened its eyes mid-service and mouthed his full name.

name: Ruby Collins
description: Talkative stylist and part-time gossip columnist.
hook: Clients keep leaving with identical scars behind their ears.

name: Frank Dawes
description: Smooth talker with an endless supply of bad coffee and worse cars.
hook: One sedan on the lot refills its own gas tank overnight.

name: Nina Alvarez
description: Drives kids safely through the backroads, rain or shine.
hook: Each morning one extra child boards the bus and disappears before the final stop.

name: Gabe Hollow
description: Knows every tree in the county and names them like friends.
hook: Found a new trail one night — it vanished by morning.

name: Lois Finch
description: Sells curiosities from forgotten attics.
hook: Every mirror she polishes shows the shop’s interior on fire.

name: Cody Redd
description: Adrenaline junkie hiding grief behind laughter.
hook: Keeps seeing the same figure standing in every blaze’s reflection.

name: Janice Tiller
description: Friendly checkout worker who tracks everyone’s business.
hook: Her scanner sometimes displays names instead of barcodes — of people recently deceased.

name: Travis Boone
description: Rambling storyteller with a flask and a frightening memory for details.
hook: Claims to have seen the town burn down — next Thursday.

name: Becca Lorne
description: Art kid who paints eerie landscapes of places no one recognizes.
hook: Her newest painting perfectly depicts last night’s unsolved crime scene.

name: Earl Tatum
description: Generations on the same land, no one’s sure how old he really is.
hook: His fields bloom under a new moon with crops that don’t match any seed sold locally.

name: Greta Miles
description: Sweet hostess offering homemade pies and unsettling smiles.
hook: Guests always check out happy — but none of them leave town afterward.

name: Riley Darnell
description: Writes small-town fluff pieces but dreams of breaking big stories.
hook: The paper archives keep deleting any mention of the old mine collapse.

name: Noah Pierce
description: Carves elaborate wooden angels for the churchyard.
hook: One statue started crying sap — that hardens into teeth.

name: Chloe Dent
description: Keeps calm hands even with feral animals.
hook: A litter of kittens she treated all share the same mismatched eyes as her.

name: Paul Ingram
description: Affable politician who never seems to lose elections.
hook: His campaign photos show the same crowd of supporters — identical faces for twenty years.

name: Sadie North
description: Lives in a cluttered barn filled with clocks that all tick in unison.
hook: At midnight, every clock stops — and resumes one minute later with her voice whispering.
